ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 1-2 hours
3 hr
Between 5 and 8 depending on reading length.

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: I really liked the class overall, but it was much too easy. I was expecting more involvement of microbiology. Some of the topics became quite repetitive, but it was an engaging class overall. There were times when the students' comments were irrelevant and would initiate random discussions that usually proved to be an ineffective use of class time.
One of the main strengths in the interactive nature of the course.

My only complaint is I think the syllabus and the emphasis on microbiology communicate an unwelcoming message to those not in EMD. I think this class would have been stronger had there been a more diverse representation of YSPH departments. However, the syllabus and first day of class seem to discourage that when in reality, it isn't the case. Also, this is a global health option and I think it is important that people in the global health concentration feel that they are able to take the class even if they are not in EMD. My understanding was the class was brought into the curriculum to strengthen the global health program, not to add another EMD class. Because of the class make-up, I felt that we couldn't really delve into all of the important aspects of WaSH in the developing world.
One of my favorite classes.
great perspective

This has been one of the best, if not the best, overall class that I have taken at YSPH. This class really allowed us to express our opinions and discuss crucial issues in health focused around water and infectious disease. Dr. Talbert-Slagle is so in tune with and interested in what we as students have to say, she stimulates honest discussion, looks for ways to broker compromise, and fosters a collegial atmosphere in which it is possible to really assess, discuss, and suggest possible solutions to difficult situations.This was the first class in which the opinions of the students really seemed to matter and where people really were willing to share how they thought with one another. She is a tremendous professor and I will miss going to this class!Take it.
I really liked this class, we had excellent discussions every week and I learned a lot from my fellow students
Excellent course!!
Overall the course was great. Discussions were enjoyable and allowed us to learn from each other.
The teacher was always well prepared. I enjoyed being offered some input into the topics discussed during the final weeks. Overall, this was a very good course with excellent discussions.

This may be my favorite class that I've taken at YSPH. Every week, I would be excited for Wednesday because of this class. Fascinating topics, nuanced discussion, and it challenges you to think about problems from multiple angles. I also appreciated the ability to steer the class based on student interest.

The course was a good seminar covering many of the major topics in water access and sanitation around the world. The small class size made discussions productive and there was a lot of interaction with the professor.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Kristina Marie Talbert-Slagle  Kristina is delightful. She made the class an enjoyable elective.
Instructor: Kristina Marie Talbert-Slagle  Dr. Talbert-Slagle is an amazing, caring, and interactive professor.

Instructor: Kristina Marie Talbert-Slagle  Excellent instructor who is committed to teaching and ensuring there is a positive classroom environment. I wish there were more instructors like this at YSPH.
Instructor: Kristina Marie Talbert-Slagle  Best instructor I've had so far.
Instructor: Kristina Marie Talbert-Slagle  amazing

Instructor: Kristina Marie Talbert-Slagle  Dr. Talbert-Slagle is unparalleled in terms of how she communicates with the class. She sends updates in a timely fashion, responds to questions comprehensively, asks for feedback throughout the class, and takes that feedback to heart. Sheis clearly concerned with whether her students are learning and emphasizes the importance of this throughout. The reflections each week and the discussion that arises from these questions is truly engaging and exciting.She really encourages practical creativity, looks for out-of-the box solutions, and promotes discussion and innovation.

Instructor: Kristina Marie Talbert-Slagle  Kristina was fantastic, she really cared a lot about the material and conveyed that in each class. I've had a lot of classes at YSPH where the teacher didn't seem too invested in the material, but Kristina obviously cared a lot about it
Instructor: Kristina Marie Talbert-Slagle  Absolutely loved the professor! Great teaching style, and passionate about teaching this course.
Instructor: Kristina Marie Talbert-Slagle  The instructor is very enthusiastic about her work, and flexible. It always felt like she was willing to listen to student's feedback.
Instructor: Kristina Marie Talbert-Slagle  Always well prepared, receptive, and thought provoking. One of the better teachers I've had.

Instructor: Kristina Marie Talbert-Slagle  A++Kristina is hands-down the best teacher I've had at YSPH. She is passionate, engaging, and curious, and she clearly respects her students and genuinely values what we have to say.I have been generally underwhelmed by the dry lectures at YSPH, but Kristina's seminar is the bright spot in didactics at the School.Thanks, Kristina.
Instructor: Kristina Marie Talbert-Slagle  Very sensitive to student feedback, enabling the class to steer its own course and provide a learning experience that the students wanted.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Great class.
I loved this class.
It is good.
should take this course is medschool-bound
Take this class. Dr. Talbert-Slagle is one of the most dedicated professors I've had.
Excellent course! Very interactive, and has a really good time having honest discussions about water, toilets and global health.
I would recommend the course especially if the person is interested in global water issues
I would recommend this class to other students because of the quality of the instructor, the interesting course content and stimulating discussion.
Take it! This class is fantastic and you will be abetter public health practitioner for it. Don't miss the chance to be a part of this.
Class was awesome. I learned a lot, and learned how to approach water and sanitation issues.
